lines.content: * As of Level-0, this has been renamed from Duke to TrackerBot
* as part of the requirements for the iP.
/** Collection of tasks stored by TrackerBot */
* @param appName The name of the app to instantiate.
* Calls the Ui to read commands, create Commands and execute the command.
* @return If the program has requested to exit.
* Abstracts the Commands obtained from user input.

*

Command nests its child classes inside its abstraction, as there is
* a small number of available commands that can be called through the UI.

*

Every nested Command should be assigned a corresponding CommandType enum.
* Runs the command specified by the specific command.
* @param tasks The Collection of Tasks stored by TrackerBot.
* @param ui The UI object of TrackerBot, to pass status messages into.
* @throws TrackerBotException The internal TrackerBotException, for expected and recoverable
*                             errors to display on the UI.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws TrackerBotException;

*

Depending on the keyword passed in, the method will generate an
* appropriate instance of a subtype of Command. Currently, this method can generate

*
  • AddCommand, to add Tasks into the Tracker.

*
  • DeleteCommand, to remove Tasks from the Tracker.

*
  • FindCommand, to find all Tasks matching a substring.

*
  • ListCommand, to display Tasks in the Tracker.

*
  • ExitCommand, to tell the Tracker to exit.

*
  • UnknownCommand, which will throw an error on execute.
* @param keyword The keyword passed in by the user input.
* @param commandField The description of the user input.
* @return Some subtype of Command related to keyword.
public static Command of(String keyword, String commandField) {

* Enumerates the possible Command types that exist in the Command class.

*

CommandType should directly mirror the number of nested implementations of the
* Command subclass, which can be instantiated with Command.of().
/** Command to list all tasks in the task list. **/
/** Command to add a new to-do task to the task list. **/
/** Command to add a new deadline task to the task list. **/
/** Command to add a new event task to the task list. **/
/** Command to mark a task to be complete. **/
/** Command to mark a task as incomplete. **/
/** Command to search for a task. **/
/** Command to denote an unknown keyword call. **/
/** The String representation of the enum. Used to parse the command into enum. **/

*

Enum constructors are implicitly private, so the tag is not included.
* @param keyword The keyword of the task.
* Gets the keyword of the enum CommandType.
* @return The associated String keyword with the Command.
* Dedicated Exception class for the TrackerBot.

*

TrackerBotException handles any expected, recoverable errors that
* happen in TrackerBot. The expected way to handle this exception is to
* pass the error message into a Ui object for handling.
* The Deadline class for TrackerBot, inheriting from the Task class.
* This Task child contains a LocalDateTime object to complete the task by.
* @param desc The description of the Deadline task.
* @param by The String representation of the deadline to parse into a LocalDateTime object.
* @throws DateTimeParseException if the deadline cannot be parsed by TaskDateHandler.
public Deadline(String desc, String by) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Constructs a Deadline using a String array, for use in save parsing.
* @param args The arguments for constructing Deadline, containing isDone status in index
*             0, description in index 1 and an epoch Date string in index 2
* @throws DateTimeParseException if the deadline cannot be parsed by TaskDateHandler.
* @throws NumberFormatException if the epoch save string is corrupted.
protected Deadline(String[] args) throws DateTimeParseException, NumberFormatException {
* The String representation of To-do appends the [D] tag in front of the Task toString, and
* the deadline date to the end of the toString.
* @return "[D]" prefixed to task.toString(), and "(by: [deadline])" postfixed to task.toString().
* The Event class for TrackerBot, inheriting from the Task class.

*

This Task child contains 2 LocalDateTime objects to denote the interval to

*

As of version A-JavaDoc, the interval does not explicitly check for validity of
/** The start date of the event. **/

* @param from The String representation of the start date to parse into a LocalDateTime object.
* @param to The String representation of the end date to parse into a LocalDateTime object.
* @throws DateTimeParseException if the deadline cannot be parsed by TaskDateHandler.
public Event(String desc, String from, String to) throws DateTimeParseException {

* @param args The arguments for constructing Event, containing isDone status in index
*             0, description in index 1 and an epoch Date string in index 2 and 3.
* @throws DateTimeParseException if the event dates cannot be parsed by TaskDateHandler.
* @throws NumberFormatException if the epoch save string is corrupted.
protected Event(String[] args) throws DateTimeParseException, NumberFormatException {
* The String representation of To-do appends the [E] tag in front of the Task toString, and
* the event period to the end of the toString.
* @return "[D]" prefixed to task.toString(), and "(from: [start] / to: [end])" postfixed to task.toString().

*

The Task class abstracts each checklist item inside a Reminder-Type app.

*

Task should not be instantiated as a basic task. To instantiate a basic Task
* with no DateTime fields, use the To-do subtype instead.
/** The description of the task instance. **/
/** The status of the task instance. If true, the task is done. */
* Constructor for the Task class, to be called with super.
* @param desc The description of the task to create.
* Constructs a Task using a String array, for use in save parsing.

*

This should only be called by child classes in their array constructors.
* @param args The arguments for constructing a Task, containing isDone status in index
* Returns the save string for the child class.
* The save string should have the following format:

*
  • Task Flag represents the type of Task to create.

*
  • Mark Status is a 0/1 representation of the Checkmark status.

*
  • Description is the main body of the Task item to display.

*
  • Fields are the additional fields required by the Task, delimited by '|'.
* @return The '|' delimited String to store in save file.
* Factory method to generate Tasks from the save file.

*

ofSaveString expects the save string to be split before passing into Task.
* @param type The String representation of the Task in the save file.
* @param args The Arguments for each task in the save file.
* @return A Task corresponding to the type and args of the save string.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the save file is corrupted.
* @throws DateTimeParseException if the DateTime field is invalid.
public static Task ofSaveString(String type, String... args)
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Todos should have exactly 2 arguments.");
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Deadline should have exactly 3 arguments.");
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Events should have exactly 4 arguments.");
* Gets a formatted description and mark status of the Task, and
* passes it to the child classes.
* @return {Mark Status} | {Description} String, to append to toSaveString
* Helper function to determine the checkmark status of the Task.
* @return "[X]" if the task is done, "[ ]" otherwise.
* Flags the task to be completed, if able.
* @return true if the task is successfully marked to completion,
*         false if the task is already completed.
* Flags the task to be incomplete, if able.
* @return true if the task is successfully marked to be incomplete,
*         false if the task is already marked as incomplete.
* Check if the description of the Task contains the query String.
* @param searchStr The query to match any point in the description.
* @return true, if the description contains the searchStr, and false
* A Task is formatted as "[X] description of task", where the X may or
* may not be present depending on the completion status of the task.
* @return The String representation of the Task.
* Collection of Tasks for use in TrackerBot.
* The Task List array itself should be immutable, in case we override it

* @return The reply String to be passed into Ui.
* @throws TrackerBotException if the addition of the task encounters an error during parse.
public String add(CommandType type, String commandField) throws TrackerBotException {

* Attempts to toggle the item at index as complete.
* @param index The index of the Task in the TaskList, starting from 1.
* @return The reply String to be passed into Ui.
* @throws TrackerBotException if the Task specified does not exist, or is
public String markTask(int index) throws TrackerBotException {
// happy path: the task does not exist.
throw new TrackerBotException("The specified task does not exist.");
throw new TrackerBotException("The specified task is already completed.");
return "This task has been marked as completed.\n  " + task;
* Attempts to toggle the item at index as incomplete.
* @param index The index of the Task in the TaskList, starting from 1.
* @return The reply String to be passed into Ui.
* @throws TrackerBotException if the Task specified does not exist, or is
public String unmarkTask(int index) throws TrackerBotException {
// happy path: the task does not exist.
throw new TrackerBotException("The specified task does not exist.");
// we can use an exception here to denote the task is completed
throw new TrackerBotException("This task is already in progress.");
return "The task has been marked as incomplete.\n  " + task;
* Attempts to delete the item at index.
* @param index The index of the Task in the TaskList, starting from 1.
* @return The reply String to be passed into Ui.
* @throws TrackerBotException if the Task specified does not exist.
public String delete(int index) throws TrackerBotException {
// happy path: the task does not exist.
throw new TrackerBotException("The specified task does not exist.");
return "I have removed this task off of my list.\n  " + task + "\n"
+ tasks.size() + " task(s) remain on my list.";
* Deletes all items in the TaskList.

// delete the overflow \n from the last append operation
* Returns a UI-friendly String representation of the Task List.
* @return A String representation of the Task List, to pass directly into Ui.
// happy path: prints an appropriate message and exit the method.
return "No tasks have been added to the list yet.";
return "I am tracking these tasks:\n" + getListOfTasks();

* @throws DateTimeParseException if the input does not match the format string

* Displays the status message in the console.
* @param message The status message to display.
assertEquals("Cannot track task without description.", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("[E][ ] Test Input (from: 01 Dec 2000, Fri @ 12:00AM | to: 09 Dec 2000, Sat @ 12:00AM)",
// There should be an Illegal State Exception - this is not caught by the program.
* This parses user input to Date. As the parse can be variable with optional
* fields, we test to see if the parser handles bad input properly.
assertEquals("Text '' could not be parsed at index 0", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("Text '21//2 2359' could not be parsed at index 3", e.getMessage());
assertEquals("Text '21/2/20 2359' could not be parsed, unparsed text found at index 4", e.getMessage());
